channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Agatha Christie
channel.desc: Lucy Worsley explores Agatha Christie's haunted early life, revealing some secrets.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Miss Marple
channel.desc: When a party game goes horribly wrong, the attendees start to turn on each other. The only way to unravel this mystery, it seems, is to call in Miss Marple.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Miss Marple
channel.desc: Inspector Craddock is stumped, but Miss Marple has her instincts to turn to, as she delves further into the victim's past.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Miss Marple
channel.desc: Inspector Craddock is alarmed to find that Miss Marple has gone missing - has she become another victim of the murderer.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Gone
channel.desc: The police focus moves to a former colleague of Sinead's, and Diana and Richter are left blindsided by a devastating decision. Contains strong language.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Gone
channel.desc: Richter and Diana are caught in a deadly showdown as the hunt for the killer intensifies. Contains strong language and some violent scenes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: Sitcom about a couple trying to live self-sufficiently in Surbiton. Tom and Barbara's evening class becomes unusually productive.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Yes Minister
channel.desc: Jim Hacker finds himself in the middle of a row over the British Chemical Corporation.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Plague Fiction
channel.desc: Professor Laura Ashe takes a look back at the literature on the plague, starting with the 14th century, when the Black Death was sweeping the globe.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Britain's Most Fragile Treasure
channel.desc: Dr Janina Ramirez unlocks the secrets of a centuries-old masterpiece in glass, the Great East Window at York Minster, the largest expanse of medieval stained glass in the UK.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Ravel's Piano Concerto for the Left Hand at the Proms
channel.desc: One-handed concert pianist Nicholas McCarthy plays Ravel's jazz-infused classic.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: A Voice for the World
channel.desc: A profile from 1977 of the late Welsh tenor Stuart Burrows, who achieved international acclaim in the opera houses and concert halls of the world.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Stuart Burrows Sings
channel.desc: In a programme that first aired in 1986, celebrated Welsh tenor Stuart Burrows is joined by Karita Mattila, a young Aled Jones, The Pendyrus Male Choir and Beverley Humphreys.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: A Concerto for Evelyn
channel.desc: From the 1992 BBC Proms, the premiere of James MacMillan's concerto for percussion and orchestra, Veni, Veni, Emmanuel, composed for Evelyn Glennie.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Evelyn Glennie
channel.desc: The world's leading classical solo percussionist Evelyn Glennie talks to John Wilson about her career and picks out some of the key influences on her artistic path.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Maurice Ravel
channel.desc: Documentary about French composer Maurice Ravel (1875-1937), narrated by John Abineri and featuring performances of his work by Jill Gomez, Osian Ellis, Edward Beckett and others.

channel.title: A Summer Journey with Angela Rippon
channel.desc: Angela Rippon visits Bristol's historic harbour on the day of the maritime carnival and takes a pleasure cruise through the Avon Gorge and back to the Severn Estuary.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Flying Archaeologist
channel.desc: Ben Robinson flies over Wiltshire to reveal new evidence about Stonehenge that explains the reason for its location and how long ago it was occupied.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Singapore 1942
channel.desc: A 70th-anniversary television event telling the story of how the fall of Singapore in 1942 shattered myths, brought an empire to its knees, and changed the destiny of millions.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Rise of the Nazis
channel.desc: In April 1945, most of Germany is occupied by invading Allied forces. As the Soviets near Hitler's hiding place, the Nazi regime starts to disintegrate.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Hiroshima
channel.desc: Dramatic reconstruction of the devastating impact of the first atomic bomb to be used against people on the citizens of Hiroshima. Contains some scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Berlin 1945
channel.desc: The British, French and Americans wait to enter Berlin. Contains scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Ocean Autopsy
channel.desc: Oceanographer Dr Helen Czerski and zoologist Dr George McGavin carry out an 'autopsy' on the North Sea to understand the startling changes taking place in the world's oceans.
